data.title: Second Time a Charm
data.text: Delicious dinner and cocktails this weekend!  The salmon was perfectly prepared, crispy on the outside and tender inside.  The ribeye is large and juicy.  A friend said the chicken was the best he's had in a long time.  The staff is very friendly and efficient.  The last time dinner was not that great.  Glad to see the improvement!

data.title: Great ambiance, great service, average food
data.text:
While nestled inside the downtown Springfield Marriott hotel, the venue itself would be fantastic left standing alone.  It's indoor floorplan combines modern decor with plenty of private spaces - even has a trendy metal ring curtain to surround one area for private groups.  Wine selection is good for Clark County and the bar sits off to the side and a bit away from the general seating area.  It's outdoor patio sits raised about neck-high off of the ground and faces some of the famous landmarks and architecture of Springfield.  Un Mundo Cafe' is just across the street as well as many other little shops and things to walk past.  Oh, and the hotel has several large, semi-secluded lounge sections right up next to the bistro which provided a great place to chat/relax while waiting for a table and a great spot to camp at whenever the weather was too bad to walk around outdoors.

Now the food, well, average I'd say.  Prices are what you'd expect for a yuppy magnet or anything labeled "urban" to mean "modern and hip".  In Springfield, locals know that "urban" in this town is not usually synonymous with those terms.  Anyway, order whatever off of the menu and expect not to be disappointed but not thrilled either.  I'd go for the service alone actually.

Oh, speaking of service - astoundingly good.  John is the friendliest, most competent waiter that I have encountered in years.  Always kept our drinks filled and even on understaffed busy nights he still somehow keeps on top of things.  

All in all, great place for meeting family, friends, or business appointments where the conversation and ambiance is more important than the food.

data.title: Mela Now Has Patio Seating
data.text: Mela recently opened their new outdoor patio seating area, and we just had to try it!  We called a few friends and we all met at Mela a little before five.  One of our favorite bartenders, Matt, waited on us.  Although set on a corner of two roads, the traffic noise was not really a factor.  We were able to enjoy conversation (and hear each other).  We enjoyed a nice Cain Cuvee to begin our conversation. Our group followed that with two bottles of Coppola wines - a Director's Cut Pinot Noir and a DC Zinfandel - both of which went nicely with food.  We ordered from the Bar Menu and enjoyed Carb Cake, Loaded Tots, and the Lounge Burgers.  Food, friends, wine, & good service - all made this an enjoyable experience on Mela's new patio!

data.title: Disappointing Service/Website Menu
data.text: We had checked their website at home on three different occasions as to what we wanted to order so we could just go in and sit down and order.  We waited almost 10 minutes to be seated and still had to ask the bartender to get someone to get us seated.  When we ordered, we were told that the loaded fries we wanted were not available.  We had to prove to our waiter and the chef that what we wanted was on their menu on their website.  The chef told us that their website had not been updated in three years and is still not as of this posting.  We decided not to order and just left.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Mela Urban Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Skipper1949545,
I have spoken with our Executive Chef regarding this incident and he joins me in apologizing for the confusion on Saturday evening. I am sorry for both the delay in getting seated as well as the menu differences that were encountered. We believe that the website that you were looking at was a third party site and we will do our best to go through all of them and get our menus updated. Sometimes they are not as quick to make changes as we are on our personal site www.melaurbanbistro.com.
Please feel free to contact me directly if you'd like to discuss in more depth.

Regards,
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: Best Restaurant in Springfield.
data.text: I give this restaurant 5 stars relative to where it is located. It is #1 in the area. Food is good. We particularly enjoyed the salmon within our group. Also like the bar menu flat bread pizza.  Service is friendly. Bar service is super friendly as well. All the staff is very accommodating. They make good martinis.  Have never met the chef but whenever we've made special requests they are always accommodated. When we are in the area this is always our First Choice.

owner_response.author: Becky K, General Manager at Mela Urban Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
laurawB2738RX,
Thank you so much for your review and kind words. We strive to be the best that Springfield has to offer and appreciate your acknowledgement of that. Our team members are "at your service" - if we have the ingredients, we can make it! We do our best to make people happy - through our hand-crafted food, tasty beverages, and amazing service.

Thanks again. We hope to see you soon!
Becky Krieger
General Manager

data.title: Just OK
data.text: Have gone to this restruant only once for brunch.    There was plenty of good but Id rate it at just OK .   Nothing appealed to me enough to want to go back.

data.title: Only one waitress, food ok not exceptional
data.text: One waitress, Betty Jo, did a great job consdering how many people were there.  The food was only ok..my husband filet was well done rather than medium well and the vegetables (supposed to be a brussel sprout, pancetta, sweet potato hash) was waaaay overdone.. not crisp, watery and dead.  Too bad.

data.title: A very nice meal just a little pricey
data.text: We were staying at the Courtyard so this was very convenient. Service was very good and the food was delicious. We had the Salmon and the Pasta special with Lobster and both were excellent. Prices were a little high but overall a great experience. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Top-notch birthday celebration!
data.text: I attended a birthday celebration in the bar/lounge area for a friend on 6/24/15 with appetizers (and lots of wine). The appetizers we had (6 or 7?) were the best I've had in the area in years (at fundraising events, celebrations, even just out to dinner). The quality, taste, display, and especially the service were above and beyond, and everyone deserves thanks and recognition for making the evening such a memorable celebration! I live in Springfield, I visit Mela often for dinner, drinks, or both, and while I've always had good food and service there, this visit surpassed all other visits. Thank you!!

data.title: Cook vs. Chef - great place in Springfield
data.text: Confession - I hesitated eating here because it was located in a chain hotel. I was expecting blah boring hotel chain food, frozen to death and presented with a toss of plastic parsley. What a surprise! Ordered the chicken Caesar salad and got a mouth full of tangy flavor! Homemade croutons, house made dressing and slices of fresh fresh fresh grilled chicken breast still moist and not over cooked. Amazing! I also ordered the tri colored ricotta ravioli with chicken in a fresh white wine cream sauce. Holy chicken batman - far from any hotel food I've eaten. The sauce was buttery, not overly creamy and full of fresh flavor. My waiter, John, was delightful and as he stepped away, a nice lady, Sherita, stopped by my table to ask how things were. I asked if she was responsible for such a great lunch. She said she was, and I noticed her name tag said 'cook'. I told her she needed a new name tag that said 'chef' because there was no cook in the world who could have made such a wonderful lunch. Kudos to Sherita! Next stop for her? French Laundry in California! This is a great spot for a business lunch, upscale dining or if you want to have a nice solo lunch with beautiful surroundings.

data.title: Located inside the Downtown Marriott
data.text: Window views are great during the holiday season.  The outside decorations are beautiful.   Food is good but not outstanding.  Prices are a little high for the quality but I have had some pretty good meals there.  Service has always been good

data.title: Excellent meals!
data.text:
We were passing through Springfeld, Oh. last night.  While staying near by Hotel, we went to eat at this Bistro.  We the had an excellent meals.  We ordered Salmon and Shrimp capellini, both were deliciouse!  Best meals we had in a long time!   However, it was a little pricey for small town. 
we ate at the bar and the barteder were very hospitable and profesional.  Good Job guys keep up the good work!

data.title: Not a great experience
data.text: The ribeye I ordered was tenderized, without a lot of flavor.  The irritating part was the white rice side.  Awful.  I truly want to support Mela, but they need a review of their product to ensure the prices charged match the quality of output.

data.title: Good wine
data.text: One of the best if not the best wine list in Springfield.    A good cross selection at reasonable prices.  Very good bar staff also.

data.title: Delicious!!
data.text:
Our food was wonderful starting with the Shrimp Florentine Soup.  My husband had the stuffed chicken and loved it!  I had the scallops and it was great!  
Don't eat here if you are in a hurry, wasn't a big deal for us.  Our food was worth the wait.

data.title: Nice restaurant
data.text: The food has never been disappointing here. They do a decent job with the drinks too although their cosmo/ martini glasses are way  smaller than other restaurants! Unfortunately the menu stays the same so if you visit often - you will get bored! The service is pretty good when the restaurant is half full but be warned that they do not handle large crowds well - and there is ALWAYS a much longer wait for everything - not sure if they are short staffed or the kitchen can't handle it. We've only experienced this once, and complained because we like the place on the whole.

data.title: It's great!!
data.text: Whenever I need a great meal in town, I will go here. The food is many steps above typical restaurant food.

data.title: Easter Family Lunch Was Wonderful
data.text: A really marvelous Easter Family Lunch was enjoyed at Mela.  Served "family style," it all began with delightful coconut crusted shrimp with a delightful sauce; we asked for seconds and it came within minutes.  Service was prompt and friendly. The man course was prime rib with horseradish, lamb kabobs with mint sauce, and sliced ham. Several veggies and three different deserts rounded out the dinner.  My grandsons asked for more of many things including  small strawberry pies or tarts.  The food was well prepared, and when someone wanted more of anything, it was provided. A wonderful holiday meal and an even more meaningful family meal.  Thank you Mela!

data.title: update to previous review- new chef here….
data.text:
The chef raved about in a previous review is gone and things are a bit salty and creamy ----typical hotel food.  

Boo hoo.

data.title: Don't Go If You Want To Make The Show!
data.text:
I hate giving bad reviews to a place with such great food, but other people should be aware of the extremely slow service if they need to get to a show at Kuss on time.  

We parked in the theater parking lot and walked over and glad we did, because talk about slow.  Our reservation was at 6.15.  Everybody was in high spirits, and we were pleasantly surprised when we were shown to our table for nine.  Very nicely done and in a great location.  At that time, the dining room wasn't crowded... just starting to fill up.  

Our  waitress was very slow to take our order for drinks, and I was thinking it wasn't a good sign.  We got our drinks at 7.05!  The waitress finally took our orders and we got our salads at 7.25, and then I knew we were never going to make it.  I told the waitress we had an 8:00 show, and she pretty much told me so did everyone else in the place and she didn't seem like she much cared.  After that, every time she would come out of the kitchen, she wouldn't look at our table.  

At 7.35, a member of our party got up and asked somebody to check on our meals.  We were told that meal orders are taken in the order they are received.  Well, we were definitely not the last people to arrive in the dining room; so if what he said was true, then our waitress didn't put our orders in until much later than after we have her our orders.  

At 7:40, someone other than our waitress came out and said our food was under the warming dishes and would be right out.  We asked her for some takeout boxes at that point.  There was ONE person left in the dining room.  

At 7.42, the food arrived with the takeout boxes and we asked for the check.  We talked to somebody else we could nab, coming out of the kitchen, and he pretty much said it wasn't their fault.  He said they take the orders as they come in - first come, first served - and they need about an hour and a half to two hours before a show.  Isn't that what we did?  And we were not the last people to place our orders.  I will say the food was great.  but I bolted it down so fast, I'm not sure.

At 7.50, another member of our party got up and stood by the kitchen door and told them if we didn't get our bills, we were leaving without paying.  At 7.55, she finally rolled out with the bills and said she couldn't take off anything, couldn't take off the gratuity, wasn't their fault.  We rushed across the street and into Kuss and the doors were locked.  We found a side door and went in about 8.07.  

I understand a restaurant can be busy.  But, it seemed as though nobody really cared, and nobody could even mouth a simple apology about the late service.  We weren't looking for free meals, but removing the gratuity or giving us some coupons for our next visit would have at least let us think they cared about us as customers.  

They apparently have so much business, they don't care about their customers.
